If the phone has internet connectivity (either through WiFi or your data signal) you can backup your photos to Google and view them on a computer. Open your Google Photos app. When you have the app open, you will select the 3 lines on the upper left to open the menu, then select Settings, then Back up and Sync.
The internal memory is part of the physical hardware. Unlike a computer,  you cannot open it up and put a larger storage device inside it. The only way to expand storage is via a SD card.

Check the signal indicators at the top of the screen: It must show two signal bars or more. If fewer, your signal is too low for reliable data speeds. It must also show a data service icon (3G, 4G, or LTE). If no internet while roaming, Check if a network short code needs to be used. Dial #RON# (#766), then Send to enable data roaming on the network.
